  <tr> <td align="right"> title </td> <td> Sentinel-5P_Atmospheric_Chemistry </td> </tr>
  <tr> <td align="right"> creator </td> <td> European Space Agency (ESA) </td> </tr>
  <tr> <td align="right"> contact_email </td> <td> car.data@sydney.edu.au </td> </tr>
  <tr> <td align="right"> abstract </td> <td> Atmospheric monitoring data from the Sentinel-5P satellite carrying the TROPOMI (Tropospheric Monitoring Instrument), as part of the Copernicus missions. Geophysical products are derived from 4 multichannel spectrometers and cover O3, NO2, SO2, CO, CH4, and HCHO gases, as well as cloud fraction, albedo, top pressure, UV aerosol index, and aerosol layer height (mid-level pressure). Data is collected globally on a daily basis with a pixel resolution of 7km x 7km. |  | Data will be publicly and freely available from the NCI when obtained by the Australian Copernicus Regional Data Hub (see http://www.copernicus.gov.au/). </td> </tr>

Radiance and irradiance data is from calibrated sensor output from 4 multichannel spectrometers, ranging from 270nm to 2385nm. Data is collected globally on a daily basis with a pixel resolution of 7km x 7km. |  | Data will be publicly and freely available from the NCI when obtained by the Australian Copernicus Regional Data Hub (see http://www.copernicus.gov.au/). </td> </tr>
